title: Add X link to Join Community and create a Flubby Gallery section with new images

requirements.text: Update the “Join Community” call-to-action in the Closing CTA section so it includes a working X (Twitter) link pointing to https://x.com/ar94595.

quotes: under join community can u add x link https://x.com/ar94595 ,so that people can join

acceptanceCriteria: The “Join Community” CTA in the Closing CTA section is clickable and navigates to https://x.com/ar94595.
The link opens in a new tab and uses safe external-link attributes (e.g., rel="noopener noreferrer").
User-facing label clearly indicates X (e.g., “Join on X” or “Join Community on X”) and remains in English.
No backend changes are required for this link to function.

requirements.text: Add a new “Flubby Gallery” section to the landing page that displays multiple Flubby images with relatable, motivational captions users can connect with.

quotes: also need more images of flubby with different captions which people can connect as flubby gallery

acceptanceCriteria: A new section titled “Flubby Gallery” is visible on the landing page.
The gallery shows at least 6 Flubby images (from new static assets) with a short caption for each item.
All captions are in English and match the site’s emotional “keep trying / never give up” tone.
The gallery layout is mobile-first (single column on small screens) and scales to a multi-column grid on larger screens.
Images are loaded from frontend static assets under /assets/generated and are not fetched from the backend.

requirements.text: Integrate the newly generated Flubby gallery images into the frontend as static assets and reference them from the new gallery section.
acceptanceCriteria: All required new gallery images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated (or the project’s established generated-assets location).
The gallery section references the exact generated filenames provided in the image requirements.
Each gallery image includes appropriate alt text in English.
No image content is served or proxied via the Motoko backend.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (Shadcn UI sources must be composed, not modified).
Do not modify immutable hook/bootstrap files listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (e.g., frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts).
Keep the backend as a single Motoko actor; no backend changes are required for this request.
nonGoals: Do not add an email signup or any form submission flow.
Do not implement image uploads, admin tooling, or any backend storage for gallery content.
Do not add third-party auth or social API integrations beyond a simple external link to X.
